newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Telecom buyback phase cost NZ$356.3 mln.
newsitem.headline: Telecom buyback phase cost NZ$356.3 mln.

text.p: Telecom Corp of New Zealand said on Wednesday it bought 54.7 million of its own shares at a total cost of NZ$356.3 million in the first stage of its $1 billion share buyback programme which finished on March 27.
The company, which started the first phase of its programme on February 20, plans to complete the purchases over a period of one year starting from the fourth quarter of its 1996/97 fiscal year.

In a statement, Telecom said the purchases in the first wave broke down as 32.26 million shares, costing $210.59 million, on the New Zealand and New York stock markets and 22.48 million shares, costing $145.71 million, off market.
The off-market purchases were from Ameritech and Bell Atlantic, which each hold one quarter of the company.
